div.span:
In keeping with Governor DeWine's orders, school buildings will remain closed through May 1st. Distance learning with continue through this time.
To view communications and resources sent by the district during this time, please visit our communications page:

span.div: Do you need an absentee ballot?
E-mail [email protected] with your name and address and we will send you one.

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Attached you will find a letter explaining some of the services that will be available to your children during the next few weeks. Thank you for your patience during this ever-changing time.

img.alt: School Closure - Monday March 16th to April 6th

div.a: School Closure - Monday March 16th to April 6th

span.div: Please read the attached letter from Steve Thompson regarding the upcoming school closure.

br.span:
Dear families,
Attached you will find our most recent Community Update with several resources available to your regarding Coronavirus and a letter from Mr. Thompson regarding the virus.
To read the Community Update online, click here: Community Update: Coronavirus Resources.
Please view this letter that explaines HS calamity days due to the delayed start of school.

p.span:
All New Student Registration for both current school year and next school year can be completed online. In person registration appointments will be scheduled once schools re-opens. We will contact you at that time.
Willoughby-Eastlake City Schools
online system for new student registration and for returning students’ annual update of information, powered by
PowerSchool. The system is a secure site which offers parents the ability to complete many paper forms online and will diminish the need to rewrite the same information on multiple forms.
Please select the link below to begin the process.
